dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, soâ€¦ nine BILLION dollars? For like, 11,500 lines of code? Is that even, uh, a real thing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, so... nine B I L L I O N dollars? For like, eleven thousand, five hundred lines of code? Is that even, uh, a real thing?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ruling is a huge setback for Oracle, which had claimed up to $9 billion in damages for breach of its intellectual property. ... The dispute centered on around 11,500 lines of code that were from Java.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, A, it's, um, it's the Oracle-Google case. You know, the Supreme Court ruling. Big deal for, like, the tech world, developers, all that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, A, it's, um, it's the Oracle-Google case. You know, the Supreme Court ruling. Big deal for, like, the tech world, developers, all that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A "big deal"? It just sounds like two giant corporations, you know, squabbling over digital pennies, basically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A big deal? It just sounds like two giant corporations, you know, squabbling over digital pennies, basically.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, not really pennies. I mean, think about it, it was a decade-long fight. Went all the way to the Supreme Court, 6-2 decision.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, not really pennies. I mean, think about it, it was a decade-long fight. Went all the way to the Supreme Court, six to two decision.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The two companies have been locked in litigation over the issue for a decade. In a 6-to-2 outcome, the Supreme Courts justices rejected a lower court decision in Oracles favor, ruling instead that Googles copying of the pieces of code known as application programming interfaces, or APIs, was fair use.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so a bunch of old judges decided on, uh, software code. I'm sure they really, truly understood APIs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so a bunch of old judges decided on, uh, software code. I'm sure they really, truly understood APIs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But that's exactly why it matters! The ruling was about "fair use." It, like, stops copyright from stifling innovation. It's a huge deal for, um, all future software development.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But that's exactly why it matters! The ruling was about fair use. It, like, stops copyright from stifling innovation. It's a huge deal for, um, all future software development.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Googles copying of the pieces of code known as application programming interfaces, or APIs, was fair use. The fair use doctrine is designed to stop copyright protections from stifling innovation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Fair use? Or just, Google got what Google wanted because they're Google and, you know, lobbying, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Fair use? Or just, Google got what Google wanted because they're Google and, you know, lobbying, apparently.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oracle did claim that, yeah. And Apple was apparently funding Oracle, like, behind the scenes, to try and, you know, hinder Android.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oracle did claim that, yeah. And Apple was apparently funding Oracle, like, behind the scenes, to try and, you know, hinder Android.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: See? Just more big tech trying to screw each other over. What's new?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: See? Just more big tech trying to screw each other over. What's new?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but this is, uh, it's bigger than that. Google said it's a win for consumers, for interoperability. And developers, you know, now they have legal certainty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but this is, uh, it's bigger than that. Google said it's a win for consumers, for interoperability. And developers, you know, now they have legal certainty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Google said the courts opinion was a victory for consumers, interoperability and computer science, and that it gives legal certainty to the next generation of developers whose new products and services will benefit consumers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, "victory for consumers." Right. That's what they always say when they, uh, expand their market power.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, victory for consumers. Right. That's what they always say when they, uh, expand their market power.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But if Oracle had won, imagine. A "tsunami of litigation," that's what the article says. Every company trying to charge for their APIs. It would've, like, killed creativity.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But if Oracle had won, imagine. A tsunami of litigation, that's what the article says. Every company trying to charge for their APIs. It would've, like, killed creativity.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Had the court ruled in Oracles favor, it could have unleashed a tsunami of litigation as other companies sought to extract payment for use of their own APIs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the court saved us from, uh, a whole bunch of lawyers billing by the hour for every app we use?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the court saved us from, uh, a whole bunch of lawyers billing by the hour for every app we use?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Essentially, yeah! It means, like, developers don't have to rebuild everything from scratch every time. It keeps things, you know, open. Even if Justice Breyer just wanted it off his desk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Essentially, yeah! It means, like, developers don't have to rebuild everything from scratch every time. It keeps things, you know, open. Even if Justice Breyer just wanted it off his desk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The author of the majority opinion, Justice Stephen Breyer, wrote that Google had copied only what was needed to allow users to put their accrued talents to work in a new and transformative program.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, that I can understand, getting something off your desk.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, that I can understand, getting something off your desk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It really was, um, a critical decision, A.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It really was, um, a critical decision, A.
